meanings.definition: To convert into money or currency.
meanings.sent1: She decided to monetise her old collection of stamps.
meanings.sent2: The company plans to monetise its intellectual property.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to monetise his deck of cards, but they kept disappearing!
meanings.sent4: Her smile could monetise happiness if it were a currency.
meanings.sent5: The sunsets in that painting seem to monetise tranquility.

meanings.definition: To profit from an asset or business venture.
meanings.sent1: He was able to monetise his investment in the stock market.
meanings.sent2: The entrepreneur sought to monetise his innovative idea.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to monetise its toy mouse by selling tickets to watch it play.
meanings.sent4: His words could monetise wisdom if they were gold coins.
meanings.sent5: The wind seemed to monetise the whispers of the trees.

meanings.definition: To make money from a product or service.
meanings.sent1: The artist hoped to monetise her paintings by selling them online.
meanings.sent2: The app developer aimed to monetise the new gaming app.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to monetise its nut-gathering skills by offering them for sale.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter could monetise joy if laughter were a form of currency.
meanings.sent5: The rain seemed to monetise the growth of the flowers in the garden.
